definitions: To call on (a deity or spirit) in prayer, as a witness, or for inspiration.
To appeal to (someone or something) as an authority for an action or in support of an argument.
To call forth or bring into operation (a law, right, etc.).
To cause to happen or to be felt; to bring about.
examples: The priest will invoke the blessings of the gods.
He decided to invoke his Fifth Amendment rights.
The new policy might invoke public criticism.
They invoked ancient traditions during the ceremony.
